title: Robbers in pig masks took slegedhammer to Rolex store in Las Vegas Bellagio Hotel
text:
No one is said to be injured, police have said (Picture: Twitter/Lara Calo) The iconic Bellagio hotel in Las Vegas is on lockdown after reports of an active shooter.
Men in pig masks reportedly took sledgehammers to the Rolex store inside the hotel.
People kill sheep, strip naked and chain themselves together at Auschwitz gates Guests have sought cover on the famous Vegas strip.
Las Vegas police however have said there is no injuries related to the robbery.
They wrote: ‘Currently investigating at Bellagio. Initial reports indicating there was an “active shooter” which was false. No injuries.’
&&&&& To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video 
Terrified guests took to social media to document the robbery.
One user wrote: ‘Literally just witnessed an armed robber in a pig mask at a Rolex store at the Bellagio and then his arrest.’
Authorities are yet to formally announce an arrest.
The ‘shooting’ reports were dismissed by police (Picture: Twitter) They added: ‘The preliminary investigation suggests that at least three suspects entered a retail store to commit the burglary.
‘It is believed that at least one suspect fired shots inside he store.
‘At this time, one suspect has taken taken into custody. Portions of the casino property remain closed while the investigation is conducted.’
Initial reports suggested that there was a man firing shots inside, with some Tweeting the masked men ‘opened fire in lobby’.
But on Twitter people were sharing pictures of the scenes:
